author: Pick Up Limes
title: Vegan 'Honey' Mustard Tofu Wraps
ingredients: ½ tsp smoked sweet paprika powder
½ tsp smoked sweet paprika powder

instructions_list: Cut the tofu into 3-inch x ½ inch (8 cm x 1 cm) sticks.
In a medium bowl, mix together the cornstarch, water and soy sauce.
In another bowl, mix together the breadcrumbs, nutritional yeast, garlic and paprika powders.
Dip the tofu sticks in the wet mixture, and then into the breadcrumbs to coat. Transfer to a plate.
Heat a large pan over medium-high heat and add the oil. Cook the tofu for 1 - 2 minutes on each side, or until golden on all sides.
Mix together the maple syrup and mustard in a medium bowl.
Use a silicone pastry brush to coat each cooked tofu strip in the maple-mustard sauce.
Mix the leftover maple-mustard sauce together with the mayo, vinegar and salt.
Add the shredded cabbage and carrot to the bowl with the mustard sauce and mix together.
Assemble the wraps by filling each tortilla with lettuce, tomato, cabbage mix and tofu tenders.
Fold and roll up like a burrito. Then toast them in a pan if desired and enjoy!
description: These wraps are not only visually appealing but also full of surprising flavours. We prepare our own crunchy tofu strips, sweet and tangy honey mustard sauce, and vegan coleslaw. Paired with a medley of fresh and crisp vegetables, you've got yourself a wrap that's nothing short of perfection!
